{{Infobox football league | logo = | pixels = | caption = | country = {{flagicon|LIB}} [[Lebanon]] | confed = [[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]] | founded = 1900 | teams = 12 | relegation = [[Lebanese Second Division]] | levels = 2 | domest_cup = [[Lebanese FA Cup]]
[[Lebanese Super Cup]]
[[Lebanese Elite Cup]]
[[Lebanese Federation Cup]] | confed_cup = [[AFC Cup]] | most successful club = [[Al-Ansar Club|Al-Ansar]] (13 Titles) | champions = [[Al Ahed|Al-Ahed]] | website = [http://www.lebanese-goal.com/ lebanese-goal.com] }} '''Lebanese Premier League''' ([[French language|French]]: Championnat du Liban de Football / [[Arabic]]: Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙÙØ¨ÙØ§ÙÙ ÙÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙÙØ¯Ù) is the top division of the [[Federation Libanaise de Football Association]] football league competitions. It was founded in 1900 and began in 1934 and their confederation is the [[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]]. There are 12 teams competing but only 10 survive a season which sees two teams getting relegated to the [[Lebanese Second Division]]. The two remaining places are taken by the promoted teams from the [[Lebanese Second Division|second highest division]]. The most successful club in the history of the league is [[Al-Ansar FC|Al-Ansar]], topping with 13 league titles while [[Nejmeh|Al-Nejmeh]] and [[Homenetmen Beirut]] have 7 titles. [[Al-Ansar FC|Al-Ansar]] set a world record by winning 11 consecutive league titles between 1988 and 1999. ==Overview== The Lebanese Premier League's fixtures are based upon home and away fixtures. The points system is the international and most used system: * Win: 3 points * Draw: 1 point * Loss: 0 points * [[Administration (football)|Entering Administration]]: 9 points deduction ==Ranking Structure== The clubs are ranked by points and tie breakers are in the following order: *Goal difference *Goals scored *Head-to-head results *Disciplinary points ==Lebanese Premier League Clubs== The 2011-2012 season includes the following teams: {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
